gpt_university_description: The University of Auckland is a top-ranked research-led institution located in Auckland, New Zealand. Established in 1883, it is the largest university in New Zealand and offers a broad range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs in various disciplines including arts, business, education, engineering, law, and sciences.
gpt_university_address: 24 Princes St, Auckland CBD, Auckland 1010, New Zealand
gpt_location_cost_of_living: Auckland has a relatively high cost of living, with expenses such as housing, transportation, and utilities being on the higher side. However, it is possible to live affordably with proper budgeting and by seeking student discounts.
gpt_location_weather: Auckland has a temperate oceanic climate with mild winters and warm summers. The average temperature ranges from 9°C to 24°C, with more rainfall experienced during the winter months.
gpt_location_description: Auckland is a vibrant and multicultural city, known for its stunning landscapes and outdoor recreation options. With beautiful harbors, parks, beaches, and volcanic islands, it offers a perfect balance between city life and natural beauty. The city also boasts a thriving arts and culture scene, with numerous galleries, museums, and theatres.
gpt_location_crime: Auckland has a moderate crime rate compared to other major cities; however, it is generally considered a safe city for students. It is always advisable to take precautions such as being aware of your surroundings and not leaving belongings unattended.
gpt_location_transportation: Auckland has a well-developed public transport system, including buses, trains, and ferries connecting different parts of the city. Students can use the AT public transport services with a discounted student card (AT HOP card) for travel.
